benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/emails - Add account email

covered: POST Valid Payload scenarios covered: creating AccountEmail with valid payload results in 201 (TC01–TC05, TC16)
Invalid Payload scenarios covered: malformed JSON, missing required fields, invalid accountId, and missing accountId (TC10, TC11, TC12, TC17, TC07, TC08)
Edge cases for payload: extra/unsupported fields (TC06)
Missing/invalid account handling: non-existent accounts (TC09), invalid accountId (TC07), missing accountId (TC08)
Large payload handling: maximum field sizes (TC16)
Header/authorization validation: missing headers (TC13), unauthorized access (TC14), optional headers (TC02, TC05)
Multiple error codes coverage across scenarios: 400/404/503 (TC07, TC08, TC09, TC10/TC11/TC12/TC13/TC15)
Regression tests: unicode input (TC21), backward compatibility (TC22)
Recovery/Resiliency: transient network failure (TC25), slow DB (TC19), concurrency (TC20)
gaps: Duplicate submission / idempotency not explicitly tested (no TC for duplicates)
500 Internal Server Error scenarios for server-side failures (not covered; only 503 for external dependencies in TC15)
Caching behavior for POST responses (ETag / Cache-Control not tested)
recommendations: Add a dedicated 500 error scenario to cover server-side failures (DB timeout, constraint violation)
Add an idempotency/duplicate submission test (resubmitting same email) and verify no duplicates or idempotent behavior
Introduce rate-limiting tests (e.g., multiple rapid requests) and observe 429 when applicable
Include caching headers checks for POST responses if applicable, or document non-caching behavior
Expand authorization tests with token expiry scenarios and refresh flows if applicable
